alert.note: Alert for Western Canyonlands (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 5:22PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Garfield and southeastern Wayne Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 521 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles southwest of Canyonlands National Park, or 39 miles southwest of Moab, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Garfield and southeastern Wayne Counties. Areas impacted include the Maze section of Canyonlands National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
